Description: Shoulder sherd of Attic black-figured pottery open vessel, dinos or krater with turn to neck or rim; interior glazed streaky black with traces of bands in added red; exterior: band of short black vertical strokes above black-figure animal frieze to left; tail of one feline and head of panther (faded red on forehead, nose and neck).
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 474-5, no. B820)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0264) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
